example_1: abrahmacariyaṃ pahāya brahmacārī ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.
example_2: pāṇaṃ na haññe na c'adinnam'ādiye, musā na bhāse na ca majjapo siyā, abrahmacariyā virameyya methunā, rattiṃ na bhuñjeyya vikālabhojanaṃ.

example_1: ten'āyaṃ desito dhammo, khayagāmī anuttaro, tassa sāsanam'āgamma, labbhate taṃ asokatā.
example_2: evaṃ tasmiṃ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo. samantapāsādikaṃ, āvuso, puggalaṃ āgamma cittaṃ pasīdati.
example_3: tatra, bhikkhave, yāni cha nekkhammasitāni somanassāni tāni nissāya tāni āgamma yāni cha gehasitāni somanassāni tāni pajahatha, tāni samatikkamatha.
example_4: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno yaṃ nimittaṃ āgamma yaṃ nimittaṃ manasikaroto uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā vitakkā chand'ūpasaṃhitā'pi dos'ūpasaṃhitā'pi moh'ūpasaṃhitā'pi

meaning: fact of having excellent friendship; fact of having spiritual companionship
example_1: na kamm'ārāmatā, na bhass'ārāmatā, na nidd'ārāmatā, na saṅgaṇik'ārāmatā ... sovacassatā, kalyāṇamittatā
khantī paramaṃ tapo titikkhā, nibbānaṃ paramaṃ vadanti buddhā, na hi pabbajito par'ūpaghātī, samaṇo hoti paraṃ viheṭhayanto.
example_2: dasa ime bhikkhave dhammā pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbā. katame dasa?
example_3: mam'eva kata maññantu, gihīpabbajitā ubho, mam'ev'ātivasā assu, kicc'ākiccesu kismici. iti bālassa saṅkappo, icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.
example_4: samudācareyyā'ti āroceyya itthiyā vā purisassa vā gahaṭṭhassa vā pabbajitassa vā.

meaning: with wrong livelihood; having a wrong mode of living
example_1: pare micchāājīvā bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammāājīvā bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.
example_2: evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchāājīvassa purisapuggalassa sammāājīvo hoti parikkamanāya, micchāvāyāmassa purisapuggalassa sammāvāyāmo hoti parikkamanāya

example_1: adāsi me akāsi me, ñātimittā sakhā ca me. petānaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ dajjā, pubbe katam'anussaraṃ.
example_2: brahmamārā ca indā ca lokapālā ca devatā, yamo, mittā manussā ca majjhattā verikā'pi ca, sabbe sattā sukhī hontu.
example_3: mitte bhajassu kalyāṇe, suddhājīve atandite, paṭisanthāravuty'assa, ācārakusalo siyā, tato pāmojjabahulo, dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.
example_4: yādisaṃ kurute mittaṃ, yādisaṃ c'ūpasevati, sa ve tādisako hoti, sahavāso hi tādiso.

example_1: muṇḍo virūpo abhisāpam'āgato, kapālahattho'va kulesu bhikkhasu, yuñjassu satthuvacane mah'esino, itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.
example_2: rukkhamūlaṃ'va nissāya, muṇḍo saṅghāṭipāruto, paññāya uttamo thero, upatisso'va jhāyati.
example_3: n'ānuyuttā tathā eke, muṇḍā saṅghāṭipārutā. sambhāvanaṃ'y'ev'icchanti, lābhasakkāramucchitā.
example_4: gacchatha, bho, imaṃ purisaṃ daḷhāya rajjuyā pacchābāhaṃ gāḷhabandhanaṃ bandhitvā khuramuṇḍaṃ karitvā

example_1: musāvādaṃ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato hoti saccavādī saccasandho theto paccayiko avisaṃvādako lokassa.
example_2: yo pāṇam'atipāteti, musāvādañ'ca bhāsati, loke adinnam'ādiyati, paradārañ'ca gacchati.

example_1: ādānataṇhaṃ vinayetha sabbaṃ, uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'cā'pi majjhe, yaṃ yañ'hi lokasmim'upādiyanti, ten'eva māro anveti jantuṃ.
example_2: yañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, diṭṭhaṃ bhāsato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ na bhāsitabban'ti vadāmi.
example_3: kiñ'cā'pi te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, piyo no attā'ti, atha kho tesaṃ appiyo attā. taṃ kissa hetu? yañ'hi appiyo appiyassa kareyya, taṃ te attanā'va attano karonti, tasmā tesaṃ appiyo attā.
example_4: taṃ kissa hetu? yañ'hi te bhavissati tatonidānaṃ bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā ārakkho vā so te na bhavissatī'ti.

meaning: practising correctly; going the right way
example_1: micchāpaṭipanno tvam'asi, aham'asmi sammāpaṭipanno. sahitaṃ me, asahitaṃ te. purevacanīyaṃ pacchā avaca, pacchāvacanīyaṃ pure avaca. adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. āropito te vādo, cara vādappamokkhāya. niggahito'si, nibbeṭhehi vā sace pahosī'ti.
example_2: na hi socati bhikkhu kadāci, maggajino sammāpaṭipanno, kittiñ'ca sukhañ'ca anubhoti, dhammadasoti tam'āhu pahit'attaṃ.
example_3: sabbe te adukkhā anupaghātā anupāyāsā apariḷāhā sammāpaṭipannā'ti, iti vadaṃ itth'eke ussādeti.
example_4: sammādiṭṭhiko … atthi sattā opapātikā, atthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañ'ca lokaṃ parañ'ca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī'ti.

example_1: ye me petā ñātī sālohitā kālaṅ'katā pasannacittā anussaranti tesaṃ taṃ mahapphalaṃ assa mah'ānisaṃsan'ti
example_2: labheyya nu kho so coro coraghātesu, āgamentu tāva bhavanto coraghātā, amukasmiṃ me gāme vā nigame vā mitt'āmaccā ñātisālohitā,

example_1: imesaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, dasannaṃ kathāvatthūnaṃ upādāy'upādāya kathaṃ katheyyātha, imesam'pi candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmah'iddhikānaṃ evaṃmah'ānubhāvānaṃ tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyeyyātha, ko pana vādo aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānan'ti!
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kūṭ'āgāre vā kūṭ'āgārasālāyaṃ vā pācīnavātapānā sūriye uggacchante vātapānena rasmi pavisitvā kv'āssa patiṭṭhitā'ti? pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan'ti.
example_3: seyyathā'pi vā panānanda, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ sūriye uggacchante, jāneyyāsi tvaṃ, ānanda, andhakāro antaradhāyissati, āloko pātubhavissatī'ti?
example_4: yathā ca, bhikkhave, tassa purisassa javo yathā ca candimasūriyānaṃ javo yathā ca yā devatā candimasūriyānaṃ purato dhāvanti tāsaṃ devatānaṃ javo

example_1: samphappalāpaṃ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī, nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ
example_2: bāhusaccañ'ca sippañ'ca, vinayo ca susikkhito. subhāsitā ca yā vācā, etam'maṅgalam'uttamaṃ
example_3: yathā'pi ruciraṃ pupphaṃ, vaṇṇavantaṃ agandhakaṃ, evaṃ subhāsitā vācā, aphalā hoti akubbato.
example_4: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgatā vācā subhāsitā hoti, no dubbhāsitā, anavajjā ca ananuvajjā ca viññūnan'ti.
